title.title: The Correspondence of John Hunt and Joshua Evans

msIdentifier.institution: Friends Historical Library of Swarthmore College

projectDesc.p: The correspondence of Quaker ministers John Hunt and Joshua Evans are stored at the Friends Historical Library of Swarthmore College. With the generous support of H. David and Joyce E. Hunt, Library staff scanned and transcribed these letters in 2023 and encoded the text in TEI. The 2023 project also included researching individuals mentioned in the text to create and update records about them in the Social Networks and Archival Context website

profileDesc.creation: Original written 1st-7th day of the 2nd month 1797

opener.dateline: Marlborough of South Carolina Piney Grove

div.p: I gladly embrace this opportunity for to inform thee that we have been favored with the company of our esteemed friend Joshua Evans thy loving companion in paying us a religious visit which hath been comfortable and satisfactory to us both at our meeting and also in visiting most of the families of our meeting which I bore him company mostly whilst amongst us greatly to my satisfaction and I may inform thee dear friend that I do sympathize with thee in thy concern situation and I believe that thou will not lose thy reward in giving up thy dear companion for I believe be a faithful servant and is diligent about his master’s business I am at this time in company with him at Pee Dee in Richmond County he is making southward for Charleston,

closer.salute: so conclude in much love to thee hoping that thou may be preserved in the patie and all will be well from thy affectionate friend and well wisher, my wife joins with me

div.p: these may inform thee that thy dear companion attended the several meetings belonging to Contentnea Quarter whose company has been truly acceptable and satisfactory to me whom I believe is a faithful servant in his great master’s work, whom I truly love I have born him company near four hundred miles and are now at Charleston
